Subject to AP Assigned Lands (POT) (AMENDMENT), section 3 (2A) and Section 3 (2B); and in accordance with GO MS no 314, Revenue (Lands-I) Department, dated: 11/11/2021, this document is hereby issued.
Therefore, from now on, you, your sons and grandsons, can freely enjoy the said Scheduled Property with the powers of donation, exchange, sale and distribution throughout your family line. encumbranceDetails.description: VILL/COL:SUNDARAPALLE/SUNDARAPALLEW-B: 11-0 SURVEY: 14/2HOUSE:11-3/83 EXTENT:75.556SQ.Yds BUILT: 182SQ. FTBoundires: [N]: THOTTARAMUDIPRASAD [S] KOMMU MUTYALU[E]: ROAD [W]: KOMMUSATYANARAYANA

sections.content:
The property covered under Sale Deed No. 135028 of 2022, dated 14/Feb/2022, executed by Government of Andhra Pradesh represented by its K.Gangavaram Tahsildar Tanikella Vydyanadha Sarma in favour of Tatapudi Veeramma, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 75.5556 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 3-83, comprised in survey number 14-2, situated in Sundarapalli Village, K.Gangavaram Mandal, erstwhile East Godavari, now within the District of Konaseema, registered at sub-registrar office Draksharama, is bounded as follows:

North by: Thottaramudi Prasad
South by: Kommu Mutyalu
East by: Road
West by: Kommu Satyanarayana
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the scheduled property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is observed from the recitals of the deed that the SRO Name is mentioned as Sundarapalli, whereas, the document is registered before the SRO Draksharama, it is, therefore advisable for F.I. to verify the same. Further It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
